Hi, I'm Michael.

I'm a front- and back-end developer with a passion for digital art. A student by day, I spend my nights working as a teaching fellow, web developer, and graphic artist.

Here, you'll get to know a bit about my interests as well as some of the cool things I've done with them over the years. Take a look around, and if you like what you see, feel free to shoot me a line!

Education

I'm currently studying Computer Science with a secondary in Statistics at Harvard University (c.o. 2018). Some relevant courses include:

  • CS50: the C/PHP/Javascript-based introductory Computer Science course at Harvard
  • CS51: a pseudo-OOP course in the (obscure) functional programming language OCaml
  • CS121: a course on computation theory and the world of P, NP, and other problems
  • CS124: that one data structures/algorithms course that every CS major goes through
  • CS171: a course on data visualization with the Javascript language, D3

Troy High School in Fullerton, CA was where my interest in Computer Science took off. There, I was enrolled in a four-year-long Computer Science pathway that taught me things ranging from circuit logic with breadboards to introductory data structures and algorithms in Java.

Skills

I've been toying around with graphic design and animation for a while now, specializing in 3D art. As a computer scientist, my main experience comes from web development. In my free time, I love tinkering with Chromebooks and DIY Linux distributions, and I often brush up on coding via Project Euler, HackerRank, and Codecademy.
